revision.comment: Notification of altered sources needing review #IABot (v1.2.4)
revision.text: {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Myanmar (Burma)|class=B|importance=Low}} {{WikiProject Southeast Asia|importance=Low|class=B}} {{WPCHINA|importance=Low|class=B}} {{WPMILHIST|class=B|B1=y|B2=y|B3=y|B4=y|B5=y|Southeast-Asian=yes}} }} {{reqphoto|in=Myanmar|in2=Yunnan}} {{OnThisDay|date1=2011-08-27|oldid1=447017700|date2=2016-08-27|oldid2=736258248}} == Name change == Is it proper to have changed the name of this incident to "Kokang rebellion"? In everything I have read so far, there is not really any mention of what the rebel armies' motivations might be, and calling it a "rebellion" makes it appear that there is some political motivation (such as independence) rather than just an explosion of tensions at the right moment. (Also, I should note that I took the name "Kokang incident" precisely from the name used in the pre-existing zh-wiki article, [[:zh:果敢八八事件]], lit. "Kokang 8 August incident"; so far no English-language sources I've seen have given this a name.) Likewise, I think "vying for control of the region", added in [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Kokang_rebellion&diff=310840181&oldid=310839835 this edit], is too much—in the lede, we don't need to put words in anyone's mouth to say ''why'' we think they are fighting, we can just report that the fighting has happened. [[User:Rjanag|rʨanaɢ]] [[User talk:Rjanag|talk]]/[[Special:Contributions/Rjanag|contribs]] 05:20, 30 August 2009 (UTC) :I know what you mean, but it doesn't seem unreasonable to me to classify the conflict as a sub-regional combat--that is, a rebellion which is not expected to escalate into civil war anytime soon. As for motivations, there's an article in the Bangkok Post (not yet available online) which suggests the group has already set up some form of officer corps. [[User:Ottre|Ottre]] 05:35, 30 August 2009 (UTC) ::this is not a rebellion, this is a '''crackdown''' "''The violence erupted after government troops moved into the enclave, seeking to dislodge local rulers and their militia who have long controlled this mountainous terrain next to China.''"[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/asia-pacific/2009/08/20098306161918344.html] I'm putting a POV tag--[[User:TheFEARgod|The'''FE''''''AR'''god]] ([[User talk:TheFEARgod|'''Ч''']]) 12:01, 30 August 2009 (UTC) :::There are a lot of different explanations for how the violence happened. What is in the article now is my best attempt so far to construct a logical narrative of events, based on all the sources I have read. As far as I can tell, the government troops moved in without violence breaking out (they were apparently aided by a "mutiny" within the ranks of the Kokang army), and after that Kokang forces started attacking government army and police troops in the mountains around the city. [[User:Rjanag|rʨanaɢ]] [[User talk:Rjanag|talk]]/[[Special:Contributions/Rjanag|contribs]] 21:08, 30 August 2009 (UTC) (out) Just for the record... [[User:Qrfqr]] also said he thinks 'incident' is better [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Qrfqr&diff=310895672&oldid=310842558]. [[User:Rjanag|rʨanaɢ]] [[User talk:Rjanag|talk]]/[[Special:Contributions/Rjanag|contribs]] 02:03, 31 August 2009 (UTC) ::::Similar articles have the names '''fighting''', '''clashes''' and '''conflict''' which are more descriptive and also '''neutral'''--[[User:TheFEARgod|The'''FE''''''AR'''god]] ([[User talk:TheFEARgod|'''Ч''']]) 14:12, 31 August 2009 (UTC) :::::Are you saying those names are better than "rebellion", or better than "incident"? I agree that 'rebellion' is a poor choice; I like 'incident', though. [[User:Rjanag|rʨanaɢ]] [[User talk:Rjanag|talk]]/[[Special:Contributions/Rjanag|contribs]] 14:21, 31 August 2009 (UTC) incident is not so good either, i think this is a follow up to the situation as it was. not the only one open to myanmar, but not the least predictable , you may want to call it an offenisve against the separatist groups and their militia, as sri lanka did for a long time, myanmar itself doubtlessly considers it that 'pacification'.[[Special:Contributions/24.132.171.225|24.132.171.225]] ([[User talk:24.132.171.225|talk]]) 19:36, 31 August 2009 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just added archive links to {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[2009 Kokang incident]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=702210277 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20090923044138/http://ca.news.yahoo.com:80/s/afp/090830/world/myanmar_china_unrest_ethnic_media to http://ca.news.yahoo.com/s/afp/090830/world/myanmar_china_unrest_ethnic_media When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know. {{sourcecheck|checked=true}} Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 04:04, 29 January 2016 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just added archive links to {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[2009 Kokang incident]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=706721190 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20091020173201/http://www.kachinnews.com:80/index.php/news/1062-burmese-troops-and-kokang-soldiers-clash.html to http://www.kachinnews.com/index.php/news/1062-burmese-troops-and-kokang-soldiers-clash.html When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know. {{sourcecheck|checked=true}} Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 22:37, 24 February 2016 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified {{plural:7|one external link|7 external links}} on [[2009 Kokang incident]].
